intro: Symphyotrichum adnatum, commonly known as the dwarf New England aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, purple to pink flower heads that bloom in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 feet and has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for native plant gardens. Its botanical features make it an important species for supporting pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native habitat.
